subject: How to Spell...?
msgSnippet: While I can think of no word offhand that would use this, I am curious as to how to spell any word that would end with a short I (ex. It ) sound? If we are
messageBody:
While I can think of no word offhand that would use this, I am curious
as to how to spell any word that would end with a "short I" (ex. "It")
sound? If we are to follow the Quikscript manual, it tells us that we
use letter #26 ("it") for when terminals that end with a "long E" (ex.
"monEY") are unstressed & letter #27 ("eat") when the terminal is
stressed (ex. "legatEE").

Also, the Quikscript manual does not clarify what to do for single
syllable words that end with a "long E" sound (stressed or otherwise).
Should all one-syllable words that end in a "long E" sound end with
letter #26 or letter #27?

While I can think of no word offhand that would use this, I am curious
as to how to spell any word that would end with a "short I" (ex. "It")
sound? If we are to follow the Quikscript manual, it tells us that we
use letter #26 ("it") for when terminals that end with a "long E" (ex.
"monEY") are unstressed & letter #27 ("eat") when the terminal is
stressed (ex. "legatEE").

Also, the Quikscript manual does not clarify what to do for single
syllable words that end with a "long E" sound (stressed or otherwise).
Should all one-syllable words that end in a "long E" sound end with
letter #26 or letter #27?
